intro: Colignonia glomerata, commonly known as the clustered colignonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a hairy texture. Colignonia glomerata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
